intro: Linaria barbata, commonly known as the hairy toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, bright yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Linaria barbata is a perennial species that blooms from spring to early summer.
